channel.title: More questions about Moparclassic
channel.description:
1. How do I edit player files? It shows up as random characters when i try to edit them. Ive tried using 7zip too, doesnt work.
2. How do i turn on Sound? Someone told me to check the config class, but I found nothing.
3. How do i make the world p2p, but with a f2p wild? (Eliminating "members object" when not in the wild) I put members to "true" but nothing changed.
4. How can I make a setstats command, summon, etc. The commandhandler looks completely different.
5. How can i edit the landscape? I have a great landscape that I want to implement
6. Does anyone have some good, basic www files that I can use?
Thanks

item.title: More questions about Moparclassic
item.dc:creator: @Wife_Beater Wife Beater
item.description:
@Wife_Beater wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:7, topic:452727”]1) You do it at runtime. You won’t be able to do it otherwise, because the data has been serialized. (I’m assuming that’s which implementation you’re using)

3)true
true

  1. Every command needs to have permissions added to the permission config. Under the big match, you need to add a case calling the method that actually does the command. As for writing the command itself, look at the current commands, and the one you want to make in the old source. If you’re having trouble with Scala, post what you have and I’ll help you.

  2. There are none.[/quote]

very helpful, thanks

On another note, when I try to run the DQ client it gives me this error (it compiled fine)

Uploaded with ImageShack.us

Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: More questions about Moparclassic
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

  1. You do it at runtime. You won’t be able to do it otherwise, because the data has been serialized. (I’m assuming that’s which implementation you’re using)

3)true
true

  1. Every command needs to have permissions added to the permission config. Under the big match, you need to add a case calling the method that actually does the command. As for writing the command itself, look at the current commands, and the one you want to make in the old source. If you’re having trouble with Scala, post what you have and I’ll help you.

  2. There are none.

Read full topic

item.title: More questions about Moparclassic
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Wife Beater:

How do I download the source off the site? It seems as though I can only browse it. :S

Use a svn client like TortoiseSVN http://sourceforge.net/projects/tortoisesvn/files/1.7.7/Application/

after you install it, make a new folder where you want the source, right click on it and do a checkout. You can also specify what revision # of the source you want (ex. rev. 69 is before Peeter added the status control panel).

Read full topic

item.title: More questions about Moparclassic
item.dc:creator: @Wife_Beater Wife Beater
item.description:
@Wife_Beater wrote:

[quote=“latifundio, post:4, topic:452727”][quote author=Wife Beater link=topic=555603.msg4067716#msg4067716 date=1344049397]
Also, more importantly, how would I use a regular commandhandler.java instead of the scala version? I find it incredibly difficult to create commands with scala
[/quote]

Well you could just manually revert changes made by codeforfame. It might help if you look on the history of commits before he made the changes like here

But if your having so much trouble with it you could try using darkquest, it is basically rscangel source with some updates, and you can edit sprites, landscape and stuff just like easyrscd
http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/darkquest/[/quote]

How do I download the source off the site? It seems as though I can only browse it. :S

Read full topic

item.title: More questions about Moparclassic
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Wife Beater:

Also, more importantly, how would I use a regular commandhandler.java instead of the scala version? I find it incredibly difficult to create commands with scala

Well you could just manually revert changes made by codeforfame. It might help if you look on the history of commits before he made the changes like here

But if your having so much trouble with it you could try using darkquest, it is basically rscangel source with some updates, and you can edit sprites, landscape and stuff just like easyrscd
http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/darkquest/

Read full topic

item.title: More questions about Moparclassic
item.dc:creator: @Wife_Beater Wife Beater
item.description:
@Wife_Beater wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:2, topic:452727”]1. doesn’t the server use mysql?
2. make Config.MEMBERS_FEATURES true
5. for now you can’t (unless you figure out a way to extract and repack the config files yourself)[/quote]

Theres no “players” on the mysql.

Also, more importantly, how would I use a regular commandhandler.java instead of the scala version? I find it incredibly difficult to create commands with scala

Read full topic

item.title: More questions about Moparclassic
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

  1. doesn’t the server use mysql?
  2. make Config.MEMBERS_FEATURES true
  3. for now you can’t (unless you figure out a way to extract and repack the config files yourself)

Read full topic

item.description:

  1. How do I edit player files? It shows up as random characters when i try to edit them. Ive tried using 7zip too, doesnt work.

  2. How do i turn on Sound? Someone told me to check the config class, but I found nothing.

  3. How do i make the world p2p, but with a f2p wild? (Eliminating “members object” when not in the wild) I put members to “true” but nothing changed.

Thanks
